message: but I can't assign that to a leader key - I think because the search syntax isn't OK to use in a .vimrc - do I have to create a function for this?
I wanted to create a command to open a line at the end of a block of lines
Seems to work for me with "map <leader>b /^$<cr>ko". Does it error at all when you try and map it?
Also, "ko" is the same as "O", and you can condense the whole thing down to "map <leader>b }O".
Since "}" moves to the next empty line.
doh - I was just missing that actual map command.  But O !=ko because it won't preserve the indent of the block - but good point on the }, thanks @mtarbit
